title: 104_s1241
content: The Public Broadcasting Financial Independence and Family Viewing Act of 1995 establishes guidelines for family-friendly programming and prohibits the use of federal funds for indecent or nudity-inclusive broadcasts. It emphasizes the importance of public broadcasting providing educational, cultural, and entertaining content suitable for family viewing. SEC. 5. SPECTRUM FLEXIBILITY. The Commission will allow public broadcast license holders to use their spectrum for ancillary services, ensuring proceeds benefit public broadcasting and fees for non-broadcasting use are at market rates. SEC. 6. SCHEDULE FLEXIBILITY. SEC. 6. SCHEDULE FLEXIBILITY. The Commission will allow public broadcast license holders to provide non-public broadcast programming for a fee between 1 a.m. and 6 a.m. or offer commercially sponsored programming, ensuring proceeds benefit public broadcasting and fees are at market rates. SEC. 7. ENHANCED UNDERWRITING. Amends sections of title 47 to allow for calls to action, inducements to buy, sell, rent, or lease, and provision of price information in promotions. SEC. 8. SATELLITE, COMMON CARRIER AND OTHER FORMS OF PROGRAM DISTRIBUTION. Public Broadcasting programming can be distributed via satellite, common carrier, or other telecommunications technology for a fee, with proceeds benefiting public broadcasting. The Commission can approve frequency exchanges between public and commercial broadcasters for the national public broadcasting system's benefit. Agreements for programming should ensure public broadcasting benefits from ancillary product sales. GAO will review these provisions. The General Accounting Office will review the operations of public broadcasting entities and make recommendations for improvement. They will also study the feasibility of merging public broadcasting with international broadcasting operations. Additionally, educational rates will be addressed. Public broadcast licensees qualify for educational telecommunications service rates for providing public broadcasting.
